Classes¶

class classes.workflow.Workflow(graphml)[source]¶

Workflow class acts as a wrapper for all things associated with a task workflow. A workflow object is a struct to keep associated data together.

graph = None¶

Initialised from graphml file

load_attributes(attr, calc_time=True, perc_peak=1.0)[source]¶

Attributes in the json file: ‘comp’ - the total FLOPS cost of each task ‘resource’ - the supplied FLOP/s ‘edge’ - a second dictionary in which the data products between nodes is stored

If calc_time is True, then we calculate how much time each tasks takes based on the resource demand of the application and the supplied FLOPs/sec provided by each ‘resource’. We also calculate how much time data transfers take based on the ‘data_rate’ matrix that is present in json.

If calc_time is False, then the time has already been calculated, and we have been provided with a cost vector per task instead.
